title: Woman snatches cash from 7-year-old boy, hits mother at grocery store in viral video
content: In Bronx, a woman stole cash from a 7-year-old boy at Richard's Fruit and Vegetable store. She assaulted his mother before fleeing. The incident, captured on security footage, showed the woman taking around $4. The store co-owner expressed shock, noting he had previously seen the woman but never with the disguise she wore.
summary: In Bronx, a woman stole cash from a 7-year-old boy at Richard's Fruit and Vegetable store. She assaulted his mother before fleeing. The incident, captured on security footage, showed the woman taking around $4. The store co-owner expressed shock, noting he had previously seen the woman but never with the disguise she wore.

title: Bomb survivors use Nobel Peace Prize win to share their anti-nuke message with younger generations
content: Nihon Hidankyo, an organization of atomic bomb survivors, won the Nobel Peace Prize for their activism against nuclear weapons. As survivors age, they are committed to passing their message to younger generations. High school students are inspired and pledging to continue the movement.
summary: Nihon Hidankyo, an organization of atomic bomb survivors, won the Nobel Peace Prize for their activism against nuclear weapons. As survivors age, they are committed to passing their message to younger generations. High school students are inspired and pledging to continue the movement.

title: Planned nuclear plant in Kenyan top tourist hub, home to endangered species sparks protest
content: Dozens of protesters in Kilifi County, Kenya, rally against the construction of the country's first nuclear power plant, expressing concerns about environmental harm, health risks, and threats to livelihoods dependent on eco-tourism. Activists demand more public involvement and scrutiny of the project.
summary: Dozens of protesters in Kilifi County, Kenya, rally against the construction of the country's first nuclear power plant, expressing concerns about environmental harm, health risks, and threats to livelihoods dependent on eco-tourism. Activists demand more public involvement and scrutiny of the project.

title: Israel army warns south Lebanon residents 'not to return to homes'
content: The Israeli military has advised residents of south Lebanon to avoid returning to their homes due to ongoing combat with Hezbollah militants. Both health workers and civilians are warned against using ambulances, which may be exploited by militants. Meanwhile, intense ground and air assaults continue in Gaza.
summary: The Israeli military has advised residents of south Lebanon to avoid returning to their homes due to ongoing combat with Hezbollah militants. Both health workers and civilians are warned against using ambulances, which may be exploited by militants. Meanwhile, intense ground and air assaults continue in Gaza.

title: Karachi Airport explosion linked to foreign intelligence agency: Preliminary report
content: A preliminary report on the explosion near Karachi's Jinnah International Airport suggests the involvement of a foreign intelligence agency. The suicide bombing, believed to be orchestrated by the Balochistan Liberation Army, targeted Chinese engineers, killing two nationals and injuring 17 others, aiming to damage Pakistan-China relations. A case has been registered at the Airport police station under the supervision of the station house officer.
summary: A preliminary report on the explosion near Karachi's Jinnah International Airport suggests the involvement of a foreign intelligence agency. The suicide bombing, believed to be orchestrated by the Balochistan Liberation Army, targeted Chinese engineers, killing two nationals and injuring 17 others, aiming to damage Pakistan-China relations. A case has been registered at the Airport police station under the supervision of the station house officer.

title: Fire on board oil tanker off Germany's Baltic Sea coast has been extinguished
content: A fire on the German-flagged oil tanker Annika off the Baltic Sea coast was successfully extinguished, according to authorities. The seven-member crew was evacuated, and black smoke was visible from the coast. The fire, originating from the engine or a paint storage room, did not spread to the cargo.
summary: A fire on the German-flagged oil tanker Annika off the Baltic Sea coast was successfully extinguished, according to authorities. The seven-member crew was evacuated, and black smoke was visible from the coast. The fire, originating from the engine or a paint storage room, did not spread to the cargo.

title: 'Sugar Diddy': Mike Tyson shows support for Diddy amid sex trafficking scandal
content: Mike Tyson expressed best wishes for friend Sean 'Diddy' Combs amid legal troubles involving racketeering and sex trafficking charges. Tyson reminisced about their party days, calling him 'Sugar Diddy.' The court denied Diddy's bail for the third time, and he will remain in custody until his trial in May 2025.
summary: Mike Tyson expressed best wishes for friend Sean 'Diddy' Combs amid legal troubles involving racketeering and sex trafficking charges. Tyson reminisced about their party days, calling him 'Sugar Diddy.' The court denied Diddy's bail for the third time, and he will remain in custody until his trial in May 2025.

title: Body parts found in Colorado freezer belong to 16-year-old last seen in 2005
content: Authorities have confirmed that the body parts found in a freezer at a Grand Junction home belong to 16-year-old Amanda Overstreet, missing since April 2005. The Mesa County Sheriff's Office is treating her death as a homicide. The remains were identified through DNA analysis, with ongoing investigations to uncover further details.
summary: Authorities have confirmed that the body parts found in a freezer at a Grand Junction home belong to 16-year-old Amanda Overstreet, missing since April 2005. The Mesa County Sheriff's Office is treating her death as a homicide. The remains were identified through DNA analysis, with ongoing investigations to uncover further details.

title: What is Trump's Operation Aurora?
content: Donald Trump introduced Operation Aurora at a rally in Aurora, Colorado, aiming to crack down on the Venezuelan gang, Tren de Aragua, by invoking the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. The plan includes deploying elite squads to deport gang members and enforcing strict penalties. He criticized the Biden-Harris administration for failing to manage national security and immigration policies.
summary: Donald Trump introduced Operation Aurora at a rally in Aurora, Colorado, aiming to crack down on the Venezuelan gang, Tren de Aragua, by invoking the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. The plan includes deploying elite squads to deport gang members and enforcing strict penalties. He criticized the Biden-Harris administration for failing to manage national security and immigration policies.

title: 'Animals, savages': After Springfield attack, Trump again fuels anti-immigrant rhetoric
content: Donald Trump, during a speech in Aurora, Colorado, claimed that the country is occupied by criminal foreigners. He promised that November 5, 2024, will be Liberation Day. He proposed using the Alien Enemies Act for mass deportations. Local officials rebuffed his statements, saying Aurora is safe and not overrun by gangs.
summary: Donald Trump, during a speech in Aurora, Colorado, claimed that the country is occupied by criminal foreigners. He promised that November 5, 2024, will be Liberation Day. He proposed using the Alien Enemies Act for mass deportations. Local officials rebuffed his statements, saying Aurora is safe and not overrun by gangs.

title: Kamala Harris' Indian roots will be a significant advantage in the elections: Brookings Institute professor
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump ramp up campaigns ahead of the November 5 election. Both hold events in Pennsylvania, with Harris backed by former President Obama. Polls show a tight race; key issues include the economy, immigration, and abortion rights. Voter turnout and Harris's Indian roots could influence the outcome.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump ramp up campaigns ahead of the November 5 election. Both hold events in Pennsylvania, with Harris backed by former President Obama. Polls show a tight race; key issues include the economy, immigration, and abortion rights. Voter turnout and Harris's Indian roots could influence the outcome.

title: Watch: 100s of raccoons surround a woman in Washington
content: A woman in Kitsap County was forced to flee her property after being surrounded by 50 to 100 aggressive raccoons, which she had been feeding for a decade. Initially starting with a few, the raccoon population exploded, demanding food constantly and causing damage to her home and car. Authorities advised her to stop feeding them, leading to their gradual dispersal.
summary: A woman in Kitsap County was forced to flee her property after being surrounded by 50 to 100 aggressive raccoons, which she had been feeding for a decade. Initially starting with a few, the raccoon population exploded, demanding food constantly and causing damage to her home and car. Authorities advised her to stop feeding them, leading to their gradual dispersal.

title: Pakistan: Imran Khan's party to hold protest at Islamabad's D-Chowk on October 15
content: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) plans a protest at Islamabad’s D-Chowk on October 15, the start of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit. PTI demands the release of detained members and protests alleged government oppression. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif condemns the timing, comparing it to past disruptive protests. Tensions rise ahead of the international event.
summary: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) plans a protest at Islamabad’s D-Chowk on October 15, the start of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit. PTI demands the release of detained members and protests alleged government oppression. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif condemns the timing, comparing it to past disruptive protests. Tensions rise ahead of the international event.

title: Want to bet on US elections? This last-minute ruling has changed gambling rules
content: Millions of dollars are being wagered on the US presidential election after a court ruling legalised political gambling. Contracts for a Harris victory are trading near even with Trump's, despite concerns about misinformation. The legal debate continues, but markets remain open through Election Day.
summary: Millions of dollars are being wagered on the US presidential election after a court ruling legalised political gambling. Contracts for a Harris victory are trading near even with Trump's, despite concerns about misinformation. The legal debate continues, but markets remain open through Election Day.

title: Los Angeles recognises October 11 as National Coming Out Day
content: Los Angeles officially recognized October 11 as National Coming Out Day, commemorating the 1987 National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights. This initiative aims to create a safe and inclusive environment for the LGBTQ+ community. The city council made this move amid rising anti-LGBTQ+ legislation in the United States, emphasizing the need for acceptance and safety.
summary: Los Angeles officially recognized October 11 as National Coming Out Day, commemorating the 1987 National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights. This initiative aims to create a safe and inclusive environment for the LGBTQ+ community. The city council made this move amid rising anti-LGBTQ+ legislation in the United States, emphasizing the need for acceptance and safety.

title: Hurricane Milton impact: New York airport faces delay due to equipment issues
content: Flights at Newark Liberty International Airport faced significant delays due to an FAA equipment issue and the effects of Hurricane Milton. Inbound flights were delayed by 90 minutes on average, while departures faced 30-minute delays. Although the equipment issue has been resolved, residual delays persisted. Travellers are advised to check with airlines for updates.
summary: Flights at Newark Liberty International Airport faced significant delays due to an FAA equipment issue and the effects of Hurricane Milton. Inbound flights were delayed by 90 minutes on average, while departures faced 30-minute delays. Although the equipment issue has been resolved, residual delays persisted. Travellers are advised to check with airlines for updates.

title: Residents slog through flooded streets, clear debris after Hurricane Milton tore through Florida
content: In Florida, Hurricane Milton caused severe flooding, debris, and tornadoes, resulting in ten deaths and ongoing rescues. The storm avoided a direct hit on Tampa but left many without power and contaminated water. Environmental concerns emerged with pollution spills, while some tourist areas began recovering.
summary: In Florida, Hurricane Milton caused severe flooding, debris, and tornadoes, resulting in ten deaths and ongoing rescues. The storm avoided a direct hit on Tampa but left many without power and contaminated water. Environmental concerns emerged with pollution spills, while some tourist areas began recovering.

title: Watch: Captain clings to cooler for 8 hours in sea before getting rescued during Hurricane Milton
content: A fishing boat captain was stranded for 8 hours in the Gulf of Mexico during Hurricane Milton. Facing extreme conditions, he was rescued by the US Coast Guard with waves up to 25 feet and winds up to 90 mph. The captain survived by clinging to a cooler and using his life jacket and emergency beacon.
summary: A fishing boat captain was stranded for 8 hours in the Gulf of Mexico during Hurricane Milton. Facing extreme conditions, he was rescued by the US Coast Guard with waves up to 25 feet and winds up to 90 mph. The captain survived by clinging to a cooler and using his life jacket and emergency beacon.

title: Biden calls secretary his 'Boss' and refers to VP Harris as 'President' during Hurricane briefing
content: President Joe Biden provided an update on the federal response to recent hurricanes affecting North Carolina and Florida, highlighting efforts in power restoration and debris removal. Vice President Kamala Harris outlined federal support for essential supplies and assured continued assistance for recovery efforts.
summary: President Joe Biden provided an update on the federal response to recent hurricanes affecting North Carolina and Florida, highlighting efforts in power restoration and debris removal. Vice President Kamala Harris outlined federal support for essential supplies and assured continued assistance for recovery efforts.

title: 'It’s OK, buddy': Dog rescued from floodwaters in Florida during Hurricane Milton
content: A dog was found tied to a fence in floodwaters on a Florida highway during Hurricane Milton evacuations and is now recovering at a rescue facility. Rescued by a Florida Highway Patrol trooper, the dog, now named Trooper, remains stressed and is undergoing rehabilitation. The Leon County Humane Society condemns abandoning pets during emergencies.
summary: A dog was found tied to a fence in floodwaters on a Florida highway during Hurricane Milton evacuations and is now recovering at a rescue facility. Rescued by a Florida Highway Patrol trooper, the dog, now named Trooper, remains stressed and is undergoing rehabilitation. The Leon County Humane Society condemns abandoning pets during emergencies.
